title: Markdown Guide
body:
Markdown allows you to format text using a very simple syntax. The Markdown formatted text is only converted to HTML once it's necessary to display it. Below is a quick guide to using Markdown to create your content. For each element, the code is presented first, followed by the resulting output.

**Note: pay attention to the single space between opening symbols (e.g. \*,\#) and text.**

## Headers
# h1â€“h6
```
# h1
## h2
### h3
#### h4
##### h5
###### h6
```
# h1
## h2
### h3
#### h4
##### h5
###### h6

---

## Emphasis
#### _italics_
`_italics_ or *italics*`

#### **Bold**
`**bold**`

---

## Links
```
[My special link](/content/markdown/ "Hover text")
```
[My special link](/content/markdown/ "Hover text")

Or...

```
[My tidy link][1]
...some content and then...
[1]: /content/markdown/ "Hover text"
```
[My tidy link][1]
[1]: /content/markdown/ "Hover text"

---

## Images
```
!["Alt text"](/img/gin32.png "Hover text")
```
!["Alt text"](/img/gin32.png "Hover text")

Or...
```
!["Alt text"][gin]
...some content and then...
[gin]: /img/gin16.png "Hover text"
```
!["Alt text"][gin]
[gin]: /img/gin32.png "Hover text"

---

## Lists
#### Unordered lists
````
* item a
+ item b
- item c
```
* item a
+ item b
- item c

#### Numbered lists
```
1. item
2. item
3. item
```
1. item
2. item
3. item

#### Nesting lists
```
* item a
	1. item
	2. item
	3. item
* item b
	+ item x
	+ item y
		+ item z
```
* item a
	1. item
	2. item
	3. item
* item b
	+ item x
	+ item y
		+ item z

---

## Quotes

#### Single quote

```
> There is only one way to avoid criticism:
> do nothing, say nothing, and be nothing.
```

> There is only one way to avoid criticism: do nothing, say nothing, and be nothing.

#### Nested quote
```
> Things people have said:
> > Lots of wise things.
```
> Things people have said:
> > Lots of wise things.
